TopicTitle: Modding Monday:  BetterCrewAssignment v1.0  by Snark!

5 hours ago, Tex_NL said:

If this was policy then mods like this should be made by SQUAD. Not by random users.

(NOTE: leaving below post standing so others can learn from my mistake and fact-check before posting. And because I still stand by my words when substituting snark for an actual SQUAD dev. And because snark deserves to be a SQUAD dev, dang it.)

But snark is not simply a 'random user', he has a connection to SQUAD, which was what Wallygator referred to. He was basically asking why if it came from a SQUAD dev, it was 'just a mod' and not stock.

SQUAD devs are obviously allowed the freedom to publish mods on personal title without it attaching any consequences for SQUAD, and I welcome that, because it allows them to freely fly little tests that may otherwise never get included or remain delayed in the formal/official development process.

Depending on reception, they are free -but not obligated- to bring it to the 'potential new features' table if/whenever appropriate, and actually have some user data to back up their proposal.

Even in the worst cases that it doesn't get good user reception, or that SQUAD doesn't see a place for it in stock, it can still remain as a regular mod for the group of users that did like it, no different than a regular mod by a random not-SQUAD-connected person. Good for the users, and good for the devs because they get an outlet for their own personal ideas.

I see absolutely no problem and only benefits with letting SQUAD devs publish mods on personal title, without it having to mean it's 'made by SQUAD' with everything that entails.
